label: Petition from Alexander Blyth to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Alexander Blyth to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance from the St. Andrew's society, explaining that he is unable to ply his trade as a ship carpenter because of prolonged illness.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Alexander Blyth to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance from the St. Andrew's society, explaining that he is unable to ply his trade as a ship carpenter because of prolonged illness.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Unto the Gentlemen of the St. Andrews Club in Charles Town South Carolina

The Petition of Alexander Blyth, Ship Carpenter in Charles Town aforesaid

Humbly Sheweth,

That your Petitioner a native of Scotland has resided in this province sometime in occupying his Trade as a Ship Carpenter, and has by a Severe Sickness which has been upon him these four months past, been reduced in his Circumstances during so tedious an Illness, and having nothing else to Support him but his own hand Labour as aforesaid and that being stop'd for the above reason, and likely to be some little time longer till [until] he gets well, humbly Entreats the Gentlemen of the St. Andrews Society to bestow any small Relief for that purposes and their petitioners shall ever Pray

Alexander Blyth

metadata.label: Collection Title
metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
